timeline.bodyText: Since this is only needed in the createStepFile method, don't declare it as a class variable - just instantiate it when you need it, as you know you have a HubConfig that you can use to construct it.

timeline.bodyText: I like this try/catch, but I think we need separate ones for writing the stepDef and then the step - we should tell Pari exactly which operation failed.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: Little nit - do "step", not "Step", for consistency.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: Let's put this on a new line.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: "Please run" sounds like it's required, but it's not - we're just recommending it. Let's instead say "It is recommended to run './gradlew -i mlWatch' so that as you modify the module, it will be automatically loaded into your application's modules database." And let's put that on a new line as well.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: For consistency with the message about the step definition, do "Created step" instead of "Created a step" (I'm very picky about messages we show to users).
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText:
This doesn't allow Pari to enter e.g. "http://example.org/Customer-1.0/Customer", which she may do.
What we want to do instead is say - if the entity URI you're constructing exists, then we know Pari has entered "Customer" and she'd really appreciate it if we converted that into an entityTypeId for her. But if the URI doesn't exist, then we assume Pari entered a valid value. If it's not valid, she'll get an error when the step is saved - which is good, and the try/catch for that operation should make it very clear that saving the step failed.
timeline.author: rjrudin
